docs.snippet: President Barack Obama will host a conference highlighting the risks of head injuries to young athletes on Thursday, seeking to use the power of his office to promote awareness of ways to avoid and treat concussions, White House officials said....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama will host a conference highlighting the risks of head injuries to young athletes on Thursday, seeking to use the power of his office to promote awareness of ways to avoid and treat concussions, White House officials said.

headline.main: Obama to Spotlight Risks of Head Injuries in Sports
headline.print_headline: Obama to Spotlight Risks of Head Injuries in Sports

docs.snippet: More than a hundred students displayed their projects and inventions at what President Obama, who has been promoting the STEM subjects, called one of his favorite events....
docs.lead_paragraph: More than a hundred students displayed their projects and inventions at what President Obama, who has been promoting the STEM subjects, called one of his favorite events.
docs.abstract: More than hundred students demonstrate their inventions and research for what Pres Obama says is one of his favorite events, White House Science Fair, now in its fourth year; fair highlights education in disciplines of science, technology, engineering and mathematics, collectively known as STEM, and honors young achievers in those fields.

headline.main: Pacers Stay Alive With 93-90 Game 5 Win Over Heat
headline.print_headline: Pacers Stay Alive With 93-90 Game 5 Win Over Heat

docs.snippet: Shelly Sterling was reviewing bids from five groups interested in buying the Los Angeles Clippers, a person with knowledge of the negotiations told The Associated Press on Wednesday....

headline.print_headline: AP Source: Shelly Sterling Reviewing Clippers Bids

docs.snippet: A study of metabolism among different species suggests that humans evolved to send more energy to our big prefrontal cortex and less to our muscles....
docs.lead_paragraph: A study of metabolism among different species suggests that humans evolved to send more energy to our big prefrontal cortex and less to our muscles.
